text: Oxymeris chlorata, common name : the pink-spotted auger, is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Terebridae, the auger snails. ==Description== The shell size varies between 50 mm and 100 mm. ==Distribution== This species is distributed in the Indian Ocean along Chagos, Madagascar, the Mascarene Basin and Tanzania; in the Pacific Ocean along Pitcairn and Hawaii. ==References== * Bratcher T. & Cernohorsky W.O. (1987). Living terebras of the world. A monograph of the recent Terebridae of the world. American Malacologists, Melbourne, Florida & Burlington, Massachusetts. 240pp. * Terryn Y. (2007). Terebridae: A Collectors Guide. Conchbooks & NaturalArt. 59pp + plates ==External links== * Category:Terebridae Category:Gastropods described in 1822
title: Oxymeris chlorata
